00017| - If no code changes were produced, marks the task as `blocked` and exits.
00018| 
00019| ## Requirements
00020|

00023| - Git repo with clean working tree (recommended).
00024|

00031| ```
00032|

00035| - `--dry-run` print the task prompt without running OpenCode

00041| - Description

00043| - Strict TDD rules

00051| 
00052| ## Failure Modes
00053| 
00054| - **No changes after OpenCode run**: task is marked `blocked`; no commit or close.
00055| - **Commit fails**: runner exits with the git error; task remains in progress.
00056| - **OpenCode fails**: runner exits with the OpenCode error code.

metadata.preview:
# Yolo Runner

Runs OpenCode in YOLO mode against a single bead task at a time. The runner owns task selection, status updates, and logging; the agent only executes the task it is given.

## Location

- Canonical script: `tools/yolo-runner/beads_yolo_runner.py`
- Compatibility copy (in-use by existing invocations): `scripts/beads_yolo_runner.py`

## What It Does

- Selects the next open leaf task using beads (`bd ready`).
- Builds a task prompt with title, description, and acceptance criteria.
- Runs OpenCode with the YOLO agent using a single prompt.
- Captures OpenCode JSON output to a per-task log file.
- Commits changes, closes the bead, verifies it is closed, then runs `bd sync`.
- If no code changes were produced, marks the task as `blocked` and exits.

## Requirements

00029| **TDD requirements:**
00030| - NEVER write implementation code before a failing test exists.
00031| - Watch the test fail before writing code.
00032| - Write minimal code to pass each test.

00034| - Use real code, not mocks unless unavoidable.
00035| - All tests must pass before marking the task complete.

00038| - Each task has strict Given/When/Then acceptance criteria.

00042| **Git workflow:**
00043| - Commit the completed task immediately.
00044| - Use conventional commit messages: "feat: task name" or "fix: issue description".
00045| - Do not batch multiple tasks into one commit.

00054| - If a test passes unexpectedly, investigate why before proceeding.
00055| - Never skip writing tests for "simple" changes.

00001| # Agent Instructions
00002| 
00003| This project uses **bd** (beads) for issue tracking. Run `bd onboard` to get started.
00004| 
00005| ## Quick Reference
00006| 
00007| ```bash
00008| bd ready              # Find available work
00009| bd show <id>          # View issue details
00010| bd update <id> --status in_progress  # Claim work
00011| bd close <id>         # Complete work
00012| bd sync               # Sync with git
00013| ```
00014| 
00015| ## Landing the Plane (Session Completion)
00016| 
00017| **When ending a work session**, you MUST complete ALL steps below. Work is NOT complete until `git push` succeeds.
00018| 
00019| **MANDATORY WORKFLOW:**
00020| 
00021| 1. **File issues for remaining work** - Create issues for anything that needs follow-up
00022| 2. **Run quality gates** (if code changed) - Tests, linters, builds
00023| 3. **Update issue status** - Close finished work, update in-progress items
00024| 4. **PUSH TO REMOTE** - This is MANDATORY:
00025|    ```bash
00026|    git pull --rebase
00027|    bd sync
00028|    git push
00029|    git status  # MUST show "up to date with origin"
00030|    ```
00031| 5. **Clean up** - Clear stashes, prune remote branches
00032| 6. **Verify** - All changes committed AND pushed
00033| 7. **Hand off** - Provide context for next session
00034| 
00035| **CRITICAL RULES:**
00036| - Work is NOT complete until `git push` succeeds
00037| - NEVER stop before pushing - that leaves work stranded locally
00038| - NEVER say "ready to push when you are" - YOU must push
00039| - If push fails, resolve and retry until it succeeds
00040| 
00041|

- Create: internal/beads/client_test.go

Rules:
- This task must be implemented in Go
- Do not add new Python files

Acceptance:
- Parse `bd show <id> --json` array and use element 0

- UpdateStatus runs `bd update <id> --status <status>`

part.text:
Implemented leaf-task selection with priority ordering and epic recursion in Go, plus unit tests covering nested leaf selection, priority sorting with missing priorities last, non-open skips, task roots, and empty epics in `internal/runner/select.go` and `internal/runner/select_test.go`. Tests run: `go test ./...`.

Unrelated changes remain in `runner-logs/opencode/yolo-runner-r5w.4.jsonl` and `runner-logs/beads_yolo_runner.rewind.log`. If you want those cleaned up or ignored, say the word.
